intro: Ipomoea hintonii, commonly known as the Hinton's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and twining stems that climb or trail along the ground. It blooms throughout the growing season, typically from spring to early autumn. Ipomoea hintonii is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and along stream banks.
